result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary Duane Raatz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gary Duane Raatz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gary Duane Raatz was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Duane Raatz

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:03 PM Defendant Gary Duane Raatz in court.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Gary Duane Raatz. Victim rights compliance has been met; Court reviews charges and penalties;
As to count 1, def enters a plea of no contest, count 2 is DRI, count 3 is dismissed, Court accepts plea and enters conviction; arguments heard; def makes statement.
Court imposes the following sentence:
Sentence withheld
Probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
Maintain absolute sobriety
Not to be present at bars, taverns, liquor stores
Counseling as recommended by agent
Court costs
DNA + costs
To report to P&P by 4:30 tomorrow
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary Duane Raatz in court.  Attorney Katherine Marie Findley in court for Gary Duane Raatz. Discussion held. Court leaves on JT calendar.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:47 AM Defendant Gary Duane Raatz in court with attorney Katherine Marie Findley.  Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Return date scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
